steps.text: Slice mushrooms, finely chop the onion, and cut the celery into small pieces.
tips: Mushrooms shrink significantly, so slice them slightly thicker.

steps.text: Melt 20g butter in a pot and sauté mushrooms, onion, and celery until softened and fragrant.
tips: Low to medium heat works best to prevent burning the butter.

steps.text: Add 20g butter and 25g flour to form a roux. Stir continuously until lightly golden.
tips: A smooth roux prevents lumps in the final soup.

steps.text: Slowly add water and milk while stirring until the mixture becomes smooth. Bring to a gentle simmer.
tips: Add milk gradually to prevent curdling.

steps.text: Season with salt, white pepper, and black pepper. Continue simmering until the soup thickens.
tips: For a creamier texture, blend part of the soup and stir it back in.
